Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Passion of the Christ" (2004) directed by Mel Gibson. The movie is based on the biblical story of Jesus's crucifixion. The movie features a star-studded cast including Mel Gibson, James Cavell, Meryl Streep and many others.

Another recommendation could be "Elysium" (2013) directed by Alex Horvitz. The movie is set in a dystopian future where the very wealthy live on a man-made space station while the rest of the population resides on a ruined Earth. A man takes on a mission that could bring equality to no longer equal worlds.

Finally, another recommendation could be "The Queen" (2014) directed by Peter Cattaneo. The movie is set in modern-day England, where two detectives, Veronica Heart and Jane Lyon engage in an impossible task of taking down a Russian crime boss lady who has the police department on her payroll and she has a unique way of taking out those who work against her. Meanwhile, boss of the two detectives, Captain Peter Smith holds a secret that could put both detectives in grave danger.
